segment.source: An image file is required. Please ensure that you have chosen and uploaded a file.
segment.target: An image file is required. Please ensure that you have chosen and uploaded a file.

segment.source: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this announcement?
segment.target: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this announcement?

segment.target: Please select a year and/or month in addition to the expiry date day.

segment.target: The announcement will be displayed to readers until this date. Leave blank if the announcement should be displayed indefinitely.

segment.source: Please select a year and/or day in addition to the expiry date month.
segment.target: Please select a year and/or day in addition to the expiry date month.

segment.target: Please select a valid announcement expiry date.

segment.target: Please select a month and/or day in addition to the expiry date year.

segment.target: The full text of the announcement.

segment.source: A brief description to appear along with the announcement title.
segment.target: A brief description to appear along with the announcement title.

segment.target: A short announcement description is required.

segment.target: Please select a valid announcement type.

segment.target: Warning! All announcements with this announcement type will also be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue and delete this announcement type?

segment.target: An announcement type name is required.

segment.target: No announcement types have been created.

segment.target: The email settings have been updated.

segment.target: The review settings have been updated.

segment.target: The review reminder details have been updated.

segment.source: Are you sure you want to delete this email template?
segment.target: Are you sure you want to delete this email template?

segment.source: Are you sure you want to reset this email template to its default values?
segment.target: Are you sure you want to reset this email template to its default values?

segment.source: You are about to disable this email template. If there were system processes using this template, they will not use it anymore. Do you want to confirm this operation?
segment.target: You are about to disable this email template. If there were system processes using this template, they will not use it anymore. Do you want to confirm this operation?

segment.source: The email key can only contain letters, numbers and underscores.
segment.target: The email key can only contain letters, numbers and underscores.

segment.source: An email with the given key already exists. Email keys must be unique.
segment.target: An email with the given key already exists. Email keys must be unique.

segment.source: You must provide a context ID when adding an email template.
segment.target: You must provide a context ID when adding an email template.

segment.source: The key you provided is already in use.
segment.target: The key you provided is already in use.

segment.source: You are about to enable this email. Do you want to confirm this operation?
segment.target: You are about to enable this email. Do you want to confirm this operation?

segment.source: A unique email key containing no spaces or special characters is required for the email.
segment.target: A unique email key containing no spaces or special characters is required for the email.

segment.source: A body is required for the email.
segment.target: A body is required for the email.

segment.source: A subject is required for the email.
segment.target: A subject is required for the email.

segment.source: If you reset all templates, all modifications to the email templates will be lost. Do you want to confirm this operation?
segment.target: If you reset all templates, all modifications to the email templates will be lost. Do you want to confirm this operation?

segment.source: If you reset this template, all message data will be reset to its default value, losing all modifications. Do you want to confirm this operation?
segment.target: If you reset this template, all message data will be reset to its default value, losing all modifications. Do you want to confirm this operation?

segment.source: Delete this file or directory? Note that a directory must be empty before it can be deleted.
segment.target: Delete this file or directory? Note that a directory must be empty before it can be deleted.

segment.source: No files were found in this directory.
segment.target: No files were found in this directory.

segment.target: Are you sure you wish to delete this group?

segment.source: Are you sure you wish to delete this group membership?
segment.target: Are you sure you wish to delete this group membership?

segment.source: This system optionally allows certain critical information to be entered in several additional languages. To use this feature, select alternate locales and choose from the options listed below.
segment.target: This system optionally allows certain critical information to be entered in several additional languages. To use this feature, select alternate locales and choose from the options listed below.

segment.source: Select all locales to support on the site via a language select menu to appear on each page. The menu will only appear if more than one locale is selected.
segment.target: Select all locales to support on the site via a language select menu to appear on each page. The menu will only appear if more than one locale is selected.

segment.source: An existing user must be entered.
segment.target: An existing user must be entered.

segment.source: Send the user a welcome email containing their username and password.
segment.target: Send the user a welcome email containing their username and password.

segment.target: Select the users you would like to email by checking the boxes beside their names

segment.source: Users can be assigned to, or removed from, a role at any point.
segment.target: Users can be assigned to, or removed from, a role at any point.

segment.source: Sorry, the requested user does not exist.
segment.target: Sorry, the requested user does not exist.

segment.source: Are you sure you wish to merge the selected {$oldAccountCount} account(s) into the account with the username "{$newUsername}"? The selected {$oldAccountCount} accounts will not exist afterwards. This action is not reversible.
segment.target: Are you sure you wish to merge the selected {$oldAccountCount} account(s) into the account with the username "{$newUsername}"? The selected {$oldAccountCount} accounts will not exist afterwards. This action is not reversible.

segment.source: Please select a role at the top of the page before clicking "Enroll User".
segment.target: Please select a role at the top of the page before clicking "Enroll User".

segment.source: Please provide at least a last name for the user first.
segment.target: Please provide at least a last name for the user first.

segment.source: Require the user to change their password the next time they log in.
segment.target: Require the user to change their password the next time they log in.

segment.source: This is a site-wide plugin. Only the Site Administrator may manage this plugin.
segment.target: This is a site-wide plugin. Only the Site Administrator may manage this plugin.

segment.source: You can not delete this representative because they are assigned to the market metadata for one or more publication formats for this submission.
segment.target: You can not delete this representative because they are assigned to the market metadata for one or more publication formats for this submission.

segment.source: Use the form below to set the maximum values for the terms you wish to search for. The form is pre-populated with the calculated averages of those fields.
segment.target: Use the form below to set the maximum values for the terms you wish to search for. The form is pre-populated with the calculated averages of those fields.

segment.source: Your {$contextObjectName} is configured to record more than one usage metric. Usage statistics will be displayed in several contexts. There are cases where a single usage statistic must be used, e.g. to display an ordered list of most-used submissions or to rank search results. Please select one of the configured metrics as a default.
segment.target: Your {$contextObjectName} is configured to record more than one usage metric. Usage statistics will be displayed in several contexts. There are cases where a single usage statistic must be used, e.g. to display an ordered list of most-used submissions or to rank search results. Please select one of the configured metrics as a default.

segment.source: The system generates reports that track the details associated with site usage and submissions over a given period of time. Reports are generated in CSV format which requires a spreadsheet application to view.
segment.target: The system generates reports that track the details associated with site usage and submissions over a given period of time. Reports are generated in CSV format which requires a spreadsheet application to view.

segment.source: Items in italic and marked with * represents data that is optional to the current way of counting statistics in the system (metric type). You might have that data or not, depending on your statistics plugin configuration.
segment.target: Items in italic and marked with * represents data that is optional to the current way of counting statistics in the system (metric type). You might have that data or not, depending on your statistics plugin configuration.

segment.source: Define the columns that will be used to build the report. The columns you select here not only define which data will be presented inside the reports, but also defines the aggregation level of the statistics. For example, if you choose ID, Type and Month columns, the report will sum all views from an object from one month and will present that data in one row. If you choose Day instead of Month, each object will have a row for each day.
segment.target: Define the columns that will be used to build the report. The columns you select here not only define which data will be presented inside the reports, but also defines the aggregation level of the statistics. For example, if you choose ID, Type and Month columns, the report will sum all views from an object from one month and will present that data in one row. If you choose Day instead of Month, each object will have a row for each day.

segment.source: Define one or more object ids, comma separated (e.g. 1,2,3,4,5).
segment.target: Define one or more object ids, comma separated (e.g. 1,2,3,4,5).

segment.source: One or more city names, comma separated (e.g. City Name 1,City Name 2)
segment.target: One or more city names, comma separated (e.g. City Name 1,City Name 2)

segment.source: You have to select at least one column to generate the report.
segment.target: You have to select at least one column to generate the report.

segment.source: The following url can be used to generate the report with the current form settings. Just copy it and open it in your browser. You can also store it as your custom report url generator in your bookmarks.
segment.target: The following url can be used to generate the report with the current form settings. Just copy it and open it in your browser. You can also store it as your custom report url generator in your bookmarks.

segment.source: By object type and/or object id
segment.target: By object type and/or object id

segment.target: Enter any images, text or HTML code that you'd like to appear at the bottom of your website.

segment.source: Outline the peer review policy and processes for readers and authors. This description often includes the number of reviewers typically used in reviewing a submission, the criteria by which reviewers are asked to judge submissions, expected time required to conduct the reviews, and the principles used to select reviewers.
segment.target: Outline the peer review policy and processes for readers and authors. This description often includes the number of reviewers typically used in reviewing a submission, the criteria by which reviewers are asked to judge submissions, expected time required to conduct the reviews, and the principles used to select reviewers.

segment.source: Enter contact details, typically for a principal editorship, managing editorship, or administrative staff position, which can be displayed on your publicly accessible website.
segment.target: Enter contact details, typically for a principal editorship, managing editorship, or administrative staff position, which can be displayed on your publicly accessible website.

segment.source: This statement will appear during user registration, author submission, and on the publicly available Privacy page. In some jurisdictions, you are legally required to disclose how you handle user data in this privacy policy.
segment.target: This statement will appear during user registration, author submission, and on the publicly available Privacy page. In some jurisdictions, you are legally required to disclose how you handle user data in this privacy policy.

segment.source: Number of weeks to accept or decline a review request.
segment.target: Number of weeks to accept or decline a review request.

segment.source: Defaults can be modified for each review during the editorial process.
segment.target: Defaults can be modified for each review during the editorial process.

segment.target: Send an email reminder if a reviewer has not responded to a review request this many days after the response due date.

segment.source: This page allows the Manager to review and potentially configure the plugins that are currently installed. Plugins are divided into categories, according to their function. The categories are listed below, and within each category, its current set of plugins.
segment.target: This page allows the Manager to review and potentially configure the plugins that are currently installed. Plugins are divided into categories, according to their function. The categories are listed below, and within each category, its current set of plugins.

segment.source: This form allows you to upload and install a new plugin. Please ensure the plugin is compressed as a .tar.gz file.
segment.target: This form allows you to upload and install a new plugin. Please ensure the plugin is compressed as a .tar.gz file.

segment.source: The peer review forms created here will be presented to reviewers to complete, instead of the default form which consists of two open text boxes, the first "for author and editor," and the second "for editor." Review forms can be designated for a specific press section, and editors will have the option to choose which form to use in assigning the review. In all cases, editors will have the option of including the reviews in corresponding with the author.
segment.target: The peer review forms created here will be presented to reviewers to complete, instead of the default form which consists of two open text boxes, the first "for author and editor," and the second "for editor." In all cases, editors will have the option of including the reviews in corresponding with the author.

segment.target: Require the author to suggest keywords before accepting their submission.

segment.source: Language indicates the work's primary language using a language code ("en") with an optional country code ("en_US").
segment.target: Language indicates the work's primary language using a language code ("en") with an optional country code ("en_US").

segment.source: Do not request the submission's languages from the author during submission.
segment.target: Do not request the submission's languages from the author during submission.

segment.source: Ask the author to indication the submission's languages during submission.
segment.target: Ask the author to indication the submission's languages during submission.

segment.source: Require the author to enter the submission's languages before accepting their submission.
segment.target: Require the author to enter the submission's languages before accepting their submission.

segment.source: Any rights held over the submission, which may include Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), Copyright, and various Property Rights.
segment.target: Any rights held over the submission, which may include Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), Copyright, and various Property Rights.

segment.source: Do not request a rights disclosure from the author during submission.
segment.target: Do not request a rights disclosure from the author during submission.

segment.source: Ask the author to disclose any prior access rights during submission.
segment.target: Ask the author to disclose any prior access rights during submission.

segment.source: Require the author to disclose any prior access rights before accepting their submission.
segment.target: Require the author to disclose any prior access rights before accepting their submission.

segment.source: The source may be an ID, such as a DOI, of another work or resource from which the submission is derived.
segment.target: The source may be an ID, such as a DOI, of another work or resource from which the submission is derived.

segment.source: Do not request a source URL from the author during submission.
segment.target: Do not request a source URL from the author during submission.

segment.source: Ask the author to provide a source URL during submission.
segment.target: Ask the author to provide a source URL during submission.

segment.source: Require the author to provide a source URL before accepting their submission.
segment.target: Require the author to provide a source URL before accepting their submission.

segment.source: Subjects will be keywords, key phrases or classification codes that describe a topic of the submission.
segment.target: Subjects will be keywords, key phrases or classification codes that describe a topic of the submission.

segment.source: Do not request subjects from the author during submission.
segment.target: Do not request subjects from the author during submission.

segment.source: Ask the author to provide subjects during submission.
segment.target: Ask the author to provide subjects during submission.

segment.source: Require the author to provide subjects before accepting their submission.
segment.target: Require the author to provide subjects before accepting their submission.

segment.source: The nature or genre of the main content of the submission. The type is usually "Text", but may also be "Dataset", "Image" or any of the Dublin Core types.
segment.target: The nature or genre of the main content of the submission. The type is usually "Text", but may also be "Dataset", "Image" or any of the Dublin Core types.

segment.source: Do not request the type from the author during submission.
segment.target: Do not request the type from the author during submission.

segment.source: Ask the author to provide the type during submission.
segment.target: Ask the author to provide the type during submission.

segment.source: Require the author to provide the type before accepting their submission.
segment.target: Require the author to provide the type before accepting their submission.

segment.source: Disciplines are types of study or branches of knowledge as described by university faculties and learned societies.
segment.target: Disciplines are types of study or branches of knowledge as described by university faculties and learned societies.

segment.source: Do not request disciplines from the author during submission.
segment.target: Do not request disciplines from the author during submission.

segment.source: Ask the author to provide disciplines during submission.
segment.target: Ask the author to provide disciplines during submission.

segment.source: Require the author to provide disciplines before accepting their submission.
segment.target: Require the author to provide disciplines before accepting their submission.

segment.source: Supporting agencies may indicate the source of research funding or other institutional support that facilitated the research.
segment.target: Supporting agencies may indicate the source of research funding or other institutional support that facilitated the research.

segment.source: Do not request supporting agencies from the author during submission.
segment.target: Do not request supporting agencies from the author during submission.

segment.source: Ask the author to disclose any supporting agencies during submission.
segment.target: Ask the author to disclose any supporting agencies during submission.

segment.source: Require the author to disclose any supporting agencies before accepting their submission.
segment.target: Require the author to disclose any supporting agencies before accepting their submission.

segment.source: Collect a submission's references in a separate field. This may be required to comply with citation-tracking services such as Crossref.
segment.target: Collect a submission's references in a separate field. This may be required to comply with citation-tracking services such as Crossref.

segment.source: Do not request references from the author during submission.
segment.target: Do not request references from the author during submission.

segment.target: Ask the author to provide references during submission.

segment.source: Require the author to provide references before accepting their submission.
segment.target: Require the author to provide references before accepting their submission.

segment.source: This title already exists for another navigation menu.
segment.target: This title already exists for another navigation menu.

segment.source: A navigation menu is already assigned to this area.
segment.target: A navigation menu is already assigned to this area.

segment.source: Learn more about when this menu item will be displayed or hidden.
segment.target: Learn more about when this menu item will be displayed or hidden.

segment.source: When a menu item opens a submenu, it's link can not be followed on all devices. For example, if you have an "About" item which opens a submenu with "Contact" and "Editorial Team", the "About" link may not be reachable on all devices. In the default menu, this is handled by creating a second menu item, "About the Journal", which appears in the submenu.
segment.target: When a menu item opens a submenu, it's link can not be followed on all devices. For example, if you have an "About" item which opens a submenu with "Contact" and "Editorial Team", the "About" link may not be reachable on all devices. In the default menu, this is handled by creating a second menu item, "About the Journal", which appears in the submenu.
